title: Sidewall, 1938-62-17, ca. 1860
description: Three motifs of a paper with Neapolitan scenes enclosed in a framework of grapevine on a trellis: girl dancing the tarantella with man and woman watching; peasants mounting a hill, and man and woman picking grapes. Based on a drawing for the Sketching Society by Thomas (Urvins?), R.A., entitled 'Giving a Lesson', See Works of the Sketching Society, 1858, (VAM Library volume of lithographs), Wallpaper, Color Reproduction The Antique Dealer and Collectors Guide, London, September 1970, p.79.
